qas.question: Who is the Golden Boot award given to each season?

answers.text: The Golden Boot is awarded to the top Premier League scorer at the end of each season.

qas.question: Who has the record for most goals in the Premier League?

answers.text: Newcastle United striker Alan Shearer holds the record for most Premier League goals with 260

qas.question: How many players have achieved 100 goals?

answers.text: Twenty-four players have reached the 100-goal mark

qas.question: How many different players have won the top scorer title?

answers.text: 14 different players from 10 different clubs have won or shared the top scorers title.

qas.question: Who has the record for scoring the most goals in single season?

answers.text: Andrew Cole and Alan Shearer hold the record for most goals in a season (34) – for Newcastle and Blackburn respectively.

context: <a0_0><b10_0>The Golden Boot<b10_0/> is awarded to <a5_0>the top Premier League scorer<a5_0/> at the end of each season.<a0_0/> Former Blackburn Rovers and <a1_0>Newcastle United striker <b11_0><b12_0>Alan Shearer<b12_0/><b11_0/> holds the record for most Premier League goals with <a6_0>260<a6_0/><a1_0/>. <a2_0><a7_0>Twenty-four<a7_0/> players have reached the 100-goal mark<a2_0/>. Since the first Premier League season in 1992–93, <a3_0><a8_0>14<a8_0/> different players from 10 different clubs have won or shared the top scorers title.<a3_0/> <a9_0>Thierry Henry<a9_0/> won his fourth overall scoring title by scoring <b13_0>27<b13_0/> goals in the 2005–06 season. <a4_0><b14_0>Andrew Cole and Alan Shearer<b14_0/> hold the record for most goals in a season (34) – for Newcastle and Blackburn respectively.<a4_0/> Ryan Giggs of Manchester United holds the record for scoring goals in consecutive seasons, having scored in the first 21 seasons of the league.
